001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/** A rotation in a 2d coordinate frame represented a point on the unit circle (cosine and sine). */
016@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
017@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
018public class Rotation2d implements Interpolatable<Rotation2d> {
019  private final double m_value;
020  private final double m_cos;
021  private final double m_sin;
022
023  /** Constructs a Rotation2d with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
024  public Rotation2d() {
025    m_value = 0.0;
026    m_cos = 1.0;
027    m_sin = 0.0;
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given radian value. The x and y don't have to be normalized.
032   *
033   * @param value The value of the angle in radians.
034   */
035  @JsonCreator
036  public Rotation2d(@JsonProperty(required = true, value = "radians") double value) {
037    m_value = value;
038    m_cos = Math.cos(value);
039    m_sin = Math.sin(value);
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given x and y (cosine and sine) components.
044   *
045   * @param x The x component or cosine of the rotation.
046   * @param y The y component or sine of the rotation.
047   */
048  public Rotation2d(double x, double y) {
049    double magnitude = Math.hypot(x, y);
050    if (magnitude > 1e-6) {
051      m_sin = y / magnitude;
052      m_cos = x / magnitude;
053    } else {
054      m_sin = 0.0;
055      m_cos = 1.0;
056    }
057    m_value = Math.atan2(m_sin, m_cos);
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given degree value.
062   *
063   * @param degrees The value of the angle in degrees.
064   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
065   */
066  public static Rotation2d fromDegrees(double degrees) {
067    return new Rotation2d(Math.toRadians(degrees));
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Adds two rotations together, with the result being bounded between -pi and pi.
072   *
073   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(30).plus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(60))</code> equals
074   * <code>Rotation2d(Math.PI/2.0)</code>
075   *
076   * @param other The rotation to add.
077   * @return The sum of the two rotations.
078   */
079  public Rotation2d plus(Rotation2d other) {
080    return rotateBy(other);
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Subtracts the new rotation from the current rotation and returns the new rotation.
085   *
086   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(10).minus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(100))</code>
087   * equals <code>Rotation2d(-Math.PI/2.0)</code>
088   *
089   * @param other The rotation to subtract.
090   * @return The difference between the two rotations.
091   */
092  public Rotation2d minus(Rotation2d other) {
093    return rotateBy(other.unaryMinus());
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Takes the inverse of the current rotation. This is simply the negative of the current angular
098   * value.
099   *
100   * @return The inverse of the current rotation.
101   */
102  public Rotation2d unaryMinus() {
103    return new Rotation2d(-m_value);
104  }
105
106  /**
107   * Multiplies the current rotation by a scalar.
108   *
109   * @param scalar The scalar.
110   * @return The new scaled Rotation2d.
111   */
112  public Rotation2d times(double scalar) {
113    return new Rotation2d(m_value * scalar);
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Adds the new rotation to the current rotation using a rotation matrix.
118   *
119   * <p>The matrix multiplication is as follows:
120   *
121   * <pre>
122   * [cos_new]   [other.cos, -other.sin][cos]
123   * [sin_new] = [other.sin,  other.cos][sin]
124   * value_new = atan2(sin_new, cos_new)
125   * </pre>
126   *
127   * @param other The rotation to rotate by.
128   * @return The new rotated Rotation2d.
129   */
130  public Rotation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
131    return new Rotation2d(
132        m_cos * other.m_cos - m_sin * other.m_sin, m_cos * other.m_sin + m_sin * other.m_cos);
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Returns the radian value of the rotation.
137   *
138   * @return The radian value of the rotation.
139   */
140  @JsonProperty
141  public double getRadians() {
142    return m_value;
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Returns the degree value of the rotation.
147   *
148   * @return The degree value of the rotation.
149   */
150  public double getDegrees() {
151    return Math.toDegrees(m_value);
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Returns the cosine of the rotation.
156   *
157   * @return The cosine of the rotation.
158   */
159  public double getCos() {
160    return m_cos;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the sine of the rotation.
165   *
166   * @return The sine of the rotation.
167   */
168  public double getSin() {
169    return m_sin;
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Returns the tangent of the rotation.
174   *
175   * @return The tangent of the rotation.
176   */
177  public double getTan() {
178    return m_sin / m_cos;
179  }
180
181  @Override
182  public String toString() {
183    return String.format("Rotation2d(Rads: %.2f, Deg: %.2f)", m_value, Math.toDegrees(m_value));
184  }
185
186  /**
187   * Checks equality between this Rotation2d and another object.
188   *
189   * @param obj The other object.
190   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
191   */
192  @Override
193  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
194    if (obj instanceof Rotation2d) {
195      var other = (Rotation2d) obj;
196      return Math.hypot(m_cos - other.m_cos, m_sin - other.m_sin) < 1E-9;
197    }
198    return false;
199  }
200
201  @Override
202  public int hashCode() {
203    return Objects.hash(m_value);
204  }
205
206  @Override
207  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
208  public Rotation2d interpolate(Rotation2d endValue, double t) {
209    return plus(endValue.minus(this).times(MathUtil.clamp(t, 0, 1)));
210  }
211}
